original_title: Sri Lanka farmers given air rifles to protect crops from animals
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s Ministry of Agriculture is issuing air rifles to farmers to protect crops from animals, a statement by the Government Information Department said.
The rifles were given to farmers in Keppetiyawa along with agricultural equipment such as water tanks, water dispersal tools and water motors.
These were given to farmers cultivating pineapple, pomegranate, guava and papaya. “Agricultural implements worth 10 million rupees were given to the farmers,” the ministry said.

Air rifles were also given to farmers in Angunakolapelessa. “In order to prevent crop damage, the Hadabima Authority of Sri Lanka provided financial allocation to this program subject to the contribution of 50% from the farmers as per the request of the farmers,” the ministry said. (Colombo/Jan4/2023)
